tool.name: MerquryFK HAPplot
tool.description: Generates haplotype blobplots from HAPmaker hap-mer tables
tool.command: #set ASSEMBLY1="assembly."+$assembly_1.ext ln -s '$maternal' maternal.hap.ktab && ln -s '$paternal' paternal.hap.ktab && ln -s '$assembly_1' $ASSEMBLY1 && #if $assembly_2: #set ASSEMBLY2="assembly2."+$assembly_2.ext ln -s '$assembly_2' $ASSEMBLY2 && #end if ln -s $hapmaker_ktab_file ktab_files.tar.gz && tar --strip-components=1 -xf ktab_files.tar.gz hapmaker_ktabs/ && HAPplot @PLOTS@ $pdf -T\${GALAXY_SLOTS:-4} maternal.hap.ktab paternal.hap.ktab $ASSEMBLY1 #if $assembly_2: $ASSEMBLY2 #end if happlot

param.name: maternal
param.label: Maternal Hap-mer Ktab file generated from HAPmaker

param.name: paternal
param.label: Paternal Hap-mer Ktab file generated from HAPmaker

param.name: hapmaker_ktab_file
param.label: Select the TAR file consisting of intermediate files given out from HAPmaker

param.name: assembly_1
param.label: Assembly of genome
param.help: Must be same genome as the HAP-mer table was generated from

param.name: assembly_2
param.label: Additional assembly file
param.help: Additional genome against which to compare

tool.help:
This tool generates a haplotype blob plot for a given assemblyâ€”or for two assemblies if both are provided.
It utilizes hap-mer tables (<mat>.hap.ktab for maternal and <pat>.hap.ktab for paternal) created with HAPmaker.
Each contig (assembly segment) is represented as a blob, where: - Size corresponds to the contig's length. - Position is determined by the counts of maternal hap-mers (x-axis) and paternal hap-mers (y-axis) within the contig.
This visualization helps assess haplotype distribution and composition in genome assemblies.
